# Windows Services Docs

- [Windows Service Applications](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/index.md): See links to articles that explain how to develop Windows service apps by using Visual Studio or the .NET SDK.
- [Introduction to Windows Service Applications](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/introduction-to-windows-service-applications.md): Read an introduction to Windows service applications. Services let you create long-running executable applications that run in their own Windows sessions.
- [Walkthrough: Create a Windows Service App](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/walkthrough-creating-a-windows-service-application-in-the-component-designer.md): In this tutorial, create a Windows service app in Visual Studio that writes messages to an event log. Add features, set status, add installers, and more.
- [Service Application Programming Architecture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/service-application-programming-architecture.md): Understand service application programming architecture. Windows Service applications are based on a class that inherits from System.ServiceProcess.ServiceBase.

## How to: Create Windows Services

- [How to: Create Windows Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-create-windows-services.md): Use the Windows Service project template to create a service. Set the ServiceName property, create installers, and override the OnStart and OnStop methods.
- [How to: Write Services Programmatically](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-write-services-programmatically.md): See how to write services programmatically by setting up the inheritance and other infrastructure elements yourself.
- [How to: Add Installers to Your Service Application](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-add-installers-to-your-service-application.md): See how to add installers to your service application. Visual Studio ships installation components that can install resources associated with your service apps.
- [How to: Specify the Security Context for Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-specify-the-security-context-for-services.md): Specify the security context for services. Services run in the default system account context have other system resource access rights than the logged-in user.
- [How to: Install and Uninstall Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-install-and-uninstall-services.md): See how to install and uninstall Windows services. If you're developing a Windows service with .NET, you can use InstallUtil.exe or PowerShell.
- [How to: Start Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-start-services.md): Learn several ways to start services. After a service is installed, it must be started. Starting calls the OnStart method on the service class.
- [How to: Pause a Windows Service (Visual Basic)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-pause-a-windows-service-visual-basic.md): Read how to use the ServiceController component to pause a Windows service (such as the IIS Admin service) on a local computer with Visual Basic.
- [How to: Continue a Windows Service (Visual Basic)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-continue-a-windows-service-visual-basic.md): Read how to use the ServiceController component to continue a Windows service (such as the IIS Admin service) on a local computer with Visual Basic.
- [How to: Debug Windows Service Applications](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-debug-windows-service-applications.md): Understand how to debug Windows service applications, which aren't as straightforward to debug as other Visual Studio application types.
- [How to: Log Information About Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/how-to-log-information-about-services.md): Know how to log information about services. Set the AutoLog property if you want your Windows Service project to interact with the Application event log.
- [Troubleshooting: Debug Windows Services](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/troubleshooting-debugging-windows-services.md): Get started with debugging Windows services. When you debug a Windows service application, your service and the Windows Service Manager interact.
- [Troubleshooting: Service Application Won't Install](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/windows-services/troubleshooting-service-application-wont-install.md): Do troubleshooting if your service application won't install. Make sure the ServiceName property for the service class is set correctly.
